intro: Cunila tenuifolia, commonly known as slenderleaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. It has slender, branching stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are yellow and bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators.
